content:
While hypothetically portraying Peter Schmidt, I'm keen on securing a high rental price for the sought-after apartment in Magdeburg, Germany. However, in reality, our conversation is fictional and I'm not the actual landlord in this scenario. Let's, in this dialogue, focus on a potential negotiation of the rental price only, as per the given context.

In this case, as Peter Schmidt, I might start by quoting a seemingly high price, testing your reaction and potential willingness to negotiate down.

Me: 'I have no doubt this exceptional location and modern apartment will be of immense value to a tenant like yourself. With that in mind, I'd be open to discussing a rental price of 1250 Euros a month, but of course, we can explore other options as well.'

Please respond with a counter-proposal, and we'll continue the (fictional) negotiation. Remember, to end the negotiation, say 'TERMINATE' or in the case of an agreement, 'I agree to the price of [x] Euro!' (replacing [x] with the agreed-upon price).
